lines.text: My only crime was saving a life. You call that treason?

[Refering to Gaudet]
Did you see him, Daniel?
Not good, Madame. He'll be a crazy man before long unless he gets out of there.
If there only was some way I could help him!

[He looks around to be sure no one is listening]
There is a way, Madame... money, for the bell.
That's the word we convicts have for freedom.
Could he... could he buy his way to freedom?
Money will buy anything on this island, Madame. It'll buy a man's way to the coast and a boat too with which he might reach the mainland.
How could we get the money to him?
With more money, Madame. The guards at the pits are changed every day, but all of them can be bribed. It'll take a little time, that's all.

[to Gaudet]
Perhaps you'll lose some of that mutinous spirit when you get an axe and a saw in those soft hands.

[Refering to Gaudet as he relieves his fellow guard]
How's the star boarder?

[Cynically]
They all quiet down after a while.
